meanings.definition: A triangular sail hoisted on a stay extending from the top of the foremast or mainmast.
meanings.sent1: The staysail fluttered in the wind as the ship sailed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The sailors quickly raised the staysail to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the staysail, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the air like a staysail billowing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The bright white staysail contrasted beautifully against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: A sail set on a stay running from the head of the foremast to the bowsprit or jib boom.
meanings.sent1: The staysail helped the ship move smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent2: The crew adjusted the staysail to catch the changing wind direction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat climbed the staysail, pretending to be a pirate.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lifted his spirits like a staysail lifting in a gust of wind.
meanings.sent5: The staysail danced gracefully as the ship glided across the ocean.
